remarks: Two natural numbers are equal iff their successors are equal, i.e. the successor function is one-to-one.  One of Peano's five postulates for arithmetic.  Proposition 7.30(4) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 43.  (Contributed by NM, 3-Sep-2003.)
statement: peano4 $p |- ( ( A e. _om /\ B e. _om ) -> ( suc A = suc B <-> A = B ) ) $.
